Feeney]] |director=[[Alexandra Cassavetes|Xan Cassavetes]] |music=[[Steven Hufsteter]] |cinematography=[[John Pirozzi]] |editing=[[Iain Kennedy]] |distributor=[[IFC Films]] |released=2004 |runtime=122 minutes |country= United States |language= English |movie_series= |awards= |producer=[[Marshall Persinger]]<br>[[Rick Ross (producer)|Rick Ross]] |budget= |}} '''''Z Channel: A Magnificent Obsession''''' ([[2004 in film|2004]]) is a documentary about Los Angeles pay cable channel [[Z Channel]] which was directed by [[Xan Cassavetes]], daughter of the late Hollywood director and actor [[John Cassavetes]]. It was screened out of competition at the [[2004 Cannes Film Festival]].<ref name="festival-cannes.com">{{cite web |url=http://www.festival-cannes.com/en/archives/ficheFilm/id/4199563/year/2004.html |title=Festival de Cannes: Z Channel: A Magnificent Obsession |accessdate=2009-12-05|work=festival-cannes.com}}</ref> The documentary is about [[Z Channel]] which was one of the first pay cable TV stations in the US. Z Channel became famous for showing an eclectic variety of films, including foreign language, silent, documentary, director's cut, forgotten, overlooked, under-appreciated, erotic as well as mainstream films, without commercials and uncut and letterbox-ed when possible. The film also tells the story of Z Channel's programming director [[Jerry Harvey (screenwriter)|Jerry Harvey]] who was a true film lover, programming genius, and a man almost single handedly responsible for getting many great films shown to the public. It gives insights into Harvey's constant battle with personal demons which resulted in him ending his own life and the life of his wife in a murder-suicide. Throughout the film a variety of footage featuring some of the films shown on the Z Channel is used. This serves to underline the diversity offered on the channel in particular its attempts to expose its American viewers to undubbed foreign language films. The films ends with a montage of scenes of such films with [[Irving Berlin]]'s "[[What'll I Do?]]" theme being played over the top of them as performed by the actor [[William Atherton]] from the film ''[[The Great Gatsby (1974 film)|The Great Gatsby]]'' (1974). ==Reception== ''Z Channel'' has an overall approval rating of 100% on [[Rotten Tomatoes]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/z_channel/ |title=Rotten Tomatoes |accessdate=2010-09-05}}</ref> At [[Metacritic]], the movie managed to get 85/100 based on 4 critics<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/z-channel-a-magnificent-obsession|title=Movie Review|publisher=[[Metacritic]]|accessdate=2012-09-18}}</ref> ==Home video== The film was released to [[DVD]] in 2004 as a 2-disc special edition, which included numerous bonus features.
